title.narrative: ADVOCACY / COMMUNICATION

description.narrative: Advocacy / CommunicationUNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders, which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Advocacy / CommunicationUNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy andpartnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders

description.narrative: In 2019, Communication and Advocacy work of UNICEF DRC focused on Emergencies and other critical health related issues: (i) UNICEF's response to the Ebola outbreaks; (ii) Measles epidemic; (iii) malnutrition. Global attention focused on Ebola during the UNICEF Executive Director's visit, which generated extensive media coverage by national and international news outlets on UNICEF's Ebola response. More than 95,000,000 people were reached through this collaboration. In addition, 19,997,678 people were reached via the CO social media platforms. 2,176,084 acts of engagement were made on UNICEF's digital platforms and there are over 711,500 followers/subscribers to the office online platforms. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020

Number of communication products on the situation of children in the DRC published and disseminated as a result of UNICEF / DRC communication activities (including ponabana publications) [Nombre de produits de communication sur la situation de l'Enfant en RDC publies et diffuses resultant d'activites de communication d'UNICEF/RDC (y compris les publications de ponabana)](49880)
